dt: {bc}oppressive to or arrogantly overbearing toward others

pt: {sc}dictatorial{/sc} {sc}magisterial{/sc} {sc}dogmatic{/sc} {sc}doctrinaire{/sc} {sc}oracular{/sc} mean imposing one's will or opinions on others. {sc}dictatorial{/sc} stresses autocratic, high-handed methods and a domineering manner.
{sc}magisterial{/sc} stresses assumption or use of prerogatives appropriate to a magistrate or schoolmaster in forcing acceptance of one's opinions.
{sc}dogmatic{/sc} implies being unduly and offensively positive in laying down principles and expressing opinions.

pt.t: {it}dogmatic{/it} about what is art and what is not

pt: {sc}doctrinaire{/sc} implies a disposition to follow abstract theories in framing laws or policies affecting people.

pt.t: a {it}doctrinaire{/it} approach to improving the economy

pt: {sc}oracular{/sc} implies the manner of one who delivers opinions in cryptic phrases or with pompous dogmatism.

pt.t: a designer who is the {it}oracular{/it} voice of fashion

shortdef: of, relating to, or befitting a dictator
oppressive to or arrogantly overbearing toward others
